name: Unchained
title: Why Sony Launched Ethereum L2 Soneium and Blacklisted Some Memecoins
text:
Synopsis
Sony launched Soneium, an Ethereum Layer 2 blockchain focused on entertainment, with a unique approach to IP protection and creator economies that aims to onboard mainstream users while maintaining a balance between decentralization and intellectual property rights.

Key Insights
- Sony launched Soneium as a Layer 2 blockchain built on Ethereum using OP Stack, targeting entertainment and creator economies
- The platform has implemented IP protection mechanisms, including blocking tokens that infringe on intellectual property rights
- Soneium has already attracted 14-15 million users during its testnet phase, primarily from the US and Japan
- The platform plans to leverage Sony's entertainment subsidiaries (music, film, gaming) to create unique blockchain experiences
- Vitalik Buterin supports Soneium's approach, viewing it as a demonstration of how businesses can make fine-grained control choices on blockchain platforms
- The platform offers a 12-hour grace period for projects that may unintentionally violate IP guidelines, emphasizing communication over immediate punishment
- Soneium aims to make web3 technology accessible to mainstream users by abstracting away technical complexities
- The blockchain will focus on creating value for creators through digital collectibles, loyalty programs, and exclusive content access
- The project has faced some criticism from crypto purists about its IP restrictions and token blocking capabilities
- Sony plans to expand the platform's use cases across entertainment sectors, starting with music and film before potentially moving into gaming
